Based on their message, it seems like they are interested in the drama genre. Here are some suggestions for dramas:

1. The Shawshank Redemption (1994)
A man who has been wrongfully convicted of murder is sent to prison where he befriends a fellow inmate named Red.

2. Forrest Gump (1994)
A man with low intelligence is chosen by the U.S. military to fight in World War II.

3. Fight Club (1999)
An office worker who feels stuck in life begins attending a secret underground fighting club led by an enigmatic fighter known as "The Man".

Based on their message, it seems like they are interested in the drama genre. Here are some suggestions for dramas:

4. The Godfather (1972)
After his family is murdered, Don Vito Corleone rises to power and becomes a ruthless mafia boss.

5. The Green Mile (1999)
The story follows an innocent man named Paul Edgecombe who is sent to stand trial on death row for the murder of military officer Captain William Johnson.

6. The Pursuit of Happyness (2006)
A struggling salesman named Chris Gardner is forced to live with his 7-year-old son, Liu-Pei, while he searches for a job in San Francisco.

7. A Beautiful Mind (2001)
The film tells the story of John Nash, a brilliant mathematician who also has Asperger syndrome, an intellectual disability that makes it difficult for people with Asperger syndrome to function in normal society.

8. The Social Network (2010)
The film chronicles the founding of Facebook, one of the world's largest social networking platforms.

9. Good Will Hunting (1997)
The film tells the story of Will Hunting, a troubled young man who is on the verge of despair and giving up hope in his future, when he meets therapist Dan Bressler, who takes on the challenge of helping Will Hunting overcome his troubles and give him hope for his future.
